trans-unit.source: Binds the value of a session variable to a parameter object.
A `SessionParameter` object is typically used in order to include the value of an <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState> variable in the `Where` clause of a database query.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.SessionField%2A> property identifies the session variable from which the SessionParameter retrieves a value.
> [!NOTE] > Controls that bind data to a parameter by using a SessionParameter object might throw an exception if the specified session variable is not set.
To avoid this error (where appropriate), set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property.
Initializes a new unnamed instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter"></xref> class.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object created with the SessionParameter constructor is initialized with default values for all its properties.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.SessionField%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>.

Additionally, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.TypeCode?displayProperty=fullName>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection?displayProperty=fullName>, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is initialized to `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the class with the values of the instance specified by the original parameter.
The SessionParameter constructor is a `Protected` copy constructor used to clone a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> instance.

The values of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object, including the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.SessionField%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> properties, are all transferred to the new instance.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter"></xref> from which the current instance is initialized.
Initializes a new named instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter"></xref> class, using the specified string to identify which session state name/value pair to bind to.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> properties are initialized with default values.
The name of the parameter.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState"></xref> name/value pair that the parameter object is bound to.
The default is <xref:System.String.Empty>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter"></xref> class, by using the specified name and type, and binding the parameter to the specified session state name/value pair.
This constructor is for database types.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.ConvertEmptyStringToNull%2A> properties are initialized with default values.
The name of the parameter.
The database type that the parameter represents.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState"></xref> name/value pair that the parameter object is bound to.
The default is <xref:System.String.Empty>.

Initializes a new named and strongly typed instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter"></xref> class, using the specified string to identify which session state name/value pair to bind to.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.ConvertEmptyStringToNull%2A> properties are initialized with default values.
The name of the parameter.
The type that the parameter represents.
The default is <xref:System.TypeCode?displayProperty=fullName>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState"></xref> name/value pair that the parameter object is bound to.
The default is <xref:System.String.Empty>.
Returns a duplicate of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter"></xref> instance.

The Clone method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.%23ctor%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter%29> copy constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> class with the values of the current instance.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter"></xref> that is an exact duplicate of the current one.
Updates and returns the value of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object attempts to bind to the value of the session variable every time the Evaluate method is called.
The `context` parameter is used by the Evaluate method to retrieve the name/value pair that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object binds to.
The `control` parameter is ignored.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> of the request.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> that is associated with the Web Forms page where the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter"></xref> is used.
An object that represents the updated and current value of the parameter.
If the context or the request is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, the Evaluate method returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the name of the session variable that the parameter binds to.
The SessionField property identifies a name/value pair that is stored in the current session object associated with the Web browser.
While the SessionField property identifies the name of the pair, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> binds to its corresponding value at run time.

If the expected session string name/value pair is not found in the session, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.Evaluate%2A> method binds the parameter to the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property, if it is set.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is not set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.Evaluate%2A> method fails to bind the parameter to a value.
A string that identifies the <xref href="System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState"></xref> that the parameter binds to.
